verses.roman:
kāśī-miśra āsi' paḍila prabhura caraṇe
gṛha-sahita ātmā tāṅre kaila nivedane

synonyms: kāśī-miśra—Kāśī Miśra; āsi'—coming; paḍila—fell down; prabhura—of Lord Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; caraṇe—at the lotus feet; gṛha-sahita—with his house; ātmā—his personal self; tāṅre—unto Him; kaila—did; nivedane—submission.
translation: When Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu arrived at his house, Kāśī Miśra immediately fell down at His lotus feet and surrendered himself and all his possessions.
